verses.verse: But it displeased <WH7489> <WH5869> Jonah <WH3124> exceedingly, <WH1419> and he was very angry. <WH2734>

And he prayed <WH6419> to the LORD, <WH3068> and said, <WH559> I pray <WH577> you, O LORD, <WH3068> was not this <WH2088> my saying, <WH1697> when <WH5704> I was yet <WH5704> in my country? <WH127> Therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> I fled <WH1272> before <WH6924> to Tarshish: <WH8659> for I knew <WH3045> that you are a gracious <WH2587> God, <WH410> and merciful, <WH7349> slow <WH750> to anger, <WH639> and of great <WH7227> kindness, <WH2617> and repent <WH5162> you of the evil. <WH7451>
Therefore now, <WH6258> O LORD, <WH3068> take, <WH3947> I beseech <WH4994> you, my life <WH5315> from me; for it is better <WH2896> for me to die <WH4194> than to live. <WH2416>
Then said <WH559> the LORD, <WH3068> Do you well <WH3190> to be angry? <WH2734>

So Jonah <WH3124> went <WH3318> out of the city, <WH5892> and sat <WH3427> on the east <WH6924> side <WH6924> of the city, <WH5892> and there <WH8033> made <WH6213> him a booth, <WH5521> and sat <WH3427> under <WH8478> it in the shadow, <WH6738> till <WH5704> he might see <WH7200> what <WH4100> would become <WH1961> of the city. <WH5892>

And the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> prepared <WH4487> a gourd, <WH7021> and made it to come <WH5927> up over <WH5921> Jonah, <WH3124> that it might be a shadow <WH6738> over <WH5921> his head, <WH7218> to deliver <WH5337> him from his grief. <WH7451> So Jonah <WH3124> was exceeding <WH1419> glad <WH8056> of the gourd. <WH7021>
But God <WH430> prepared <WH4487> a worm <WH8438> when the morning <WH7837> rose <WH5927> the next <WH4283> day, <WH4283> and it smote <WH5221> the gourd <WH7021> that it withered. <WH3001>

And it came <WH1961> to pass, when the sun <WH8121> did arise, <WH2224> that God <WH430> prepared <WH4487> a vehement <WH2759> east <WH6921> wind; <WH7307> and the sun <WH8121> beat <WH5221> on the head <WH7218> of Jonah, <WH3124> that he fainted, <WH5968> and wished <WH7592> in himself to die, <WH4191> and said, <WH559> It is better <WH2896> for me to die <WH4191> than to live. <WH2416>
And God <WH430> said <WH559> to Jonah, <WH3124> Do you well <WH3190> to be angry <WH2734> for the gourd? <WH7021> And he said, <WH559> I do well <WH3190> to be angry, <WH2734> even to death. <WH4194>

Then said <WH559> the LORD, <WH3068> You have had pity <WH2347> on <WH5921> the gourd, <WH7021> for the which <WH834> you have not labored, <WH5998> neither <WH3808> made it grow; <WH1431> which came <WH1961> up in a night, <WH3915> and perished <WH6> in a night: <WH3915>

And should not I spare <WH2347> Nineveh, <WH5210> that great <WH1419> city, <WH5892> wherein are more <WH7227> then six score <WH8147> thousand <WH7239> persons <WH120> that cannot <WH3808> discern <WH3045> between <WH996> their right <WH3225> hand <WH3225> and their left <WH8040> hand; <WH8040> and also much <WH7227> cattle? <WH929>
